owner.username: San Diego Air & Space Museum Archives

description._content: Horace Balsley (1893-1942) graduated from West Texas Military Academy in 1910. He enlisted in the French Aviation Corp. in September of 1915. He flew a Voisin in Escadrille No. 97 and a Nieuport in Escadrille No. 124. He saw his first action in June of 1916 and on June 18th became the first American pilot shot down in France in WWI. When he returned to the US, he was commissioned a captain and served at various locals. After discharge, he was a technical advisor for aviation movies and in 1930 became a pilot for T.A.T.-Maddux Airlines. He died in San Francisco in 1942. Repository: San Diego Air and Space Museum Archive
